Entry.JapaneseText: 兵士からの尊敬のされ方を見るとさ、 <Eugene>って、立派な軍人だったんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: From the way that soldier looked up to you, I take it you were an excellent serviceman, <Eugene>.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺よりもっと立派な軍人はたくさんいる。 たまたま名前が知られていた、それだけだ。
Entry.EnglishText: There are many more military men who are better than I. He just happened to know my name.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今は、別の意味で有名人に なってしまったがな……
Entry.EnglishText: But now, I'm infamous for a different reason.

Entry.JapaneseText: もーッ!! そういう言い方、やめてよネ！
<Eugene>はホントに立派なんだから！ 昔も、今も……！
Entry.EnglishText: You really are excellent! You were back then and you still are!
